snippet.textDisplay:
@Natendo64 

FF9 had much more traditional gameplay than FF7 and FF8. 7 and 8 had you assign attribute/ability stuff to characters when 9 made everything simple and each character was unique. I would say that the story of 9 was better than the one in 7 and 8. 10 really is the turning point going downhill since some characters were annoying as well as other aspects, but the battle system was still alright. As for X-2, the ONLY thing I thought was good about that game was the battle system.
snippet.textOriginal:
@Natendo64 

FF9 had much more traditional gameplay than FF7 and FF8. 7 and 8 had you assign attribute/ability stuff to characters when 9 made everything simple and each character was unique. I would say that the story of 9 was better than the one in 7 and 8. 10 really is the turning point going downhill since some characters were annoying as well as other aspects, but the battle system was still alright. As for X-2, the ONLY thing I thought was good about that game was the battle system.

snippet.textDisplay:
The sign of a good game: One day, years ago, I made a friend on the streets just because I was whistling this tune. Now, 15 years later, we're still close as brothers.

Games don't have that power anymore.

snippet.textDisplay: @bdfan4ever OMG! Thank you so much for pointing out the asinine hatred SE seems to get from nostolgic whores. While I agree they where the best in their golden age on the SNES & PS1, they still make wonderful games. Dissidia, Birth by Sleep and FF13 where amazing to me, Nier was great and is SO underrated. I'd throw in The Third Birthday, even with it's wacky plot, the gameplay is intense and rewarding. SE is the reason to buy a PSP really, along with Peacewalker and playing PS1 games on the go
snippet.textOriginal: @bdfan4ever OMG! Thank you so much for pointing out the asinine hatred SE seems to get from nostolgic whores. While I agree they where the best in their golden age on the SNES & PS1, they still make wonderful games. Dissidia, Birth by Sleep and FF13 where amazing to me, Nier was great and is SO underrated. I'd throw in The Third Birthday, even with it's wacky plot, the gameplay is intense and rewarding. SE is the reason to buy a PSP really, along with Peacewalker and playing PS1 games on the go

snippet.textDisplay: Love this piece. So many memories. This game had it all, solid rpg, story, new characters, sidequests and tons to collect. Probably going to go fire up the ole snes

snippet.textDisplay: I'll always remember this particular track since it's the first one you hear when the adventure truly starts. I rented this game as soon as it came out and I was blown away by the graphics. I remember the first area where this plays, I'd just have fun running around and jumping, fighting some monsters here and there. It really was a refreshing RPG at the time, and it still is even after many playthroughs.
snippet.textOriginal: I'll always remember this particular track since it's the first one you hear when the adventure truly starts. I rented this game as soon as it came out and I was blown away by the graphics. I remember the first area where this plays, I'd just have fun running around and jumping, fighting some monsters here and there. It really was a refreshing RPG at the time, and it still is even after many playthroughs.
